sentence: The Home Depot Inc.HD reported better-than-expected results for second-quarter fiscal 2015, benefitting from strength in the core activities of its stores and persistent recovery in the U.S. housing market.
The company posted second-quarter adjusted earnings of $1.71 per share, which increased 12.5% from the year-ago quarter and beat the Zacks Consensus Estimate by a penny.
Including one-time items, quarterly earnings surged 13.8% year over year to $1.73 per share.

The Home Depot Inc. - Quarterly EPS | FindTheBest

Net sales advanced 4.3% to $24,829 million from $23,811 million in the year-ago quarter and were also ahead of the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $24,660 million.
The company's overall comparable-store sales (comps) increased 4.2% while comps in the U.S. grew 5.7%.
Gross profit in the quarter improved 4.5% to $8,635 million from $8,007 million in the year-ago quarter, primarily driven by higher sales.
Gross profit margin expanded 120 basis points (bps) to 34.8%.
Improved gross margin led operating income to soar 5.8% to $3,647 million during the quarter.
Further, operating margin expanded 20 bps to 14.7% from the year-ago quarter.
Home Depot ended the second quarter with cash and cash equivalents of $4,936 million, long-term debt (excluding current maturities) of $16,318 million and shareholders' equity of $8,637 million.
Also, during the first half of fiscal 2015, the company generated $5,934 million of net cash from operations.
Taking cue from the solid performance in the first half of fiscal 2015 and the acquisition of Interline Brands Inc., Home Depot has raised its outlook for full fiscal year.
The company now projects sales growth of 5.2%-6% compared with 4.2%-4.8% expected earlier.
Comps growth is anticipated to be in the range of 4.1%-4.9% compared with the previous forecast of 4.0%-4.6%.
Consequently, Home Depot now envisions diluted earnings per share to grow in the range of 13%-14%, with earnings estimated in the band of $5.31-$5.36 per share.
Earlier, the company had projected earnings per share growth of 11%-12% and earnings of $5.24-$5.27 per share.
The company's earnings per share guidance reflect the impact of its ongoing share repurchase program.
Year-to-date, the company has bought back $3.1 billion worth of shares and intends to repurchase shares worth $3.9 billion through the rest of fiscal 2015, for a total buybacks of $7 billion.
Some better-ranked stocks in the retail sector are American Eagle Outfitters Inc. AEO , DSW Inc. DSW and Aeropostale Inc. ARO , each carrying a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy).
